name: Year 1 and 2 Words
description: UK National Curriculum common exception words for Years 1 and 2

words.definition: I like the red ball.
I saw a cat in the garden.
I do my homework every day.
I went to the park.
Today is a sunny day.
The cover of my book is blue.
She said hello to me.
My teacher says to be quiet.
We are going to play.
They were happy yesterday.
I was at school this morning.
This is my favorite toy.
That is his new bike.
She has a little dog.
I can run very fast.
You are my best friend.
Is this your pencil?
They live next door to me.
I want to be a teacher.
He plays football on Saturdays.
Please give that to me.
She has long brown hair.
We all sat down together.
No, I don't want any cake.
Let's go to the shops.
I was tired so I went to bed.
The book was written by my dad.
This is my new coat.
Come and sit here next to me.
Put your bag over there.
Where did you put my pen?
I love playing with my friends.
Please come to my party.
Can I have some water please?
I have one brother and two sisters.
I went to the zoo once.
You can ask the teacher for help.
My friend and I play together.
I walk to school every morning.
Put your toys away now.
Don't push me on the swing.
Pull the door to open it.
My tummy is full after lunch.
We live in a big house.
This is our classroom.
Please close the door behind you.
Sit on the floor in a circle.
The poor little bird was hurt.
I'm happy because it's my birthday.
Can you help me find my shoe?
She is very kind to animals.
I don't mind waiting for you.
Hide behind the tree.
The child was playing in the sand.
All the children sat down.
We saw wild rabbits in the field.
I can climb to the top.
Most of my friends like ice cream.
I only have one sweet left.
Both of my hands are dirty.
My grandma is very old.
It's cold outside today.
The ring was made of gold.
Hold my hand when we cross.
Mum told me to tidy my room.
I brush my teeth every night.
Everybody line up at the door.
Even the baby can do it.
We had a great time at the park.
Be careful not to break the cup.
Dad cooked steak for dinner.
She wore a pretty dress.
The flowers are beautiful.
We play after we finish our work.
The car went very fast.
This is the last biscuit.
We walked past the sweet shop.
My father reads me bedtime stories.
Our class went on a trip.
The grass is wet from the rain.
Please pass me the pencil.
I helped plant some seeds.
Follow the path through the woods.
I have a bath before bedtime.
We waited for an hour.
Move over so I can sit down.
I can prove that I did it.
My reading will improve with practice.
I'm sure that's the right answer.
There's too much sugar in my tea.
I got something in my eye.
I could see the sea from my window.
You should wear your coat.
I would like some juice please.
Who is coming to play?
I ate the whole apple.
Have you got any crayons?
There are many books on the shelf.
Put your dirty clothes in the basket.
Mum is busy cooking dinner.
Lots of people came to the show.
Can I have a glass of water?
Can we do that again?
I ate half of the sandwich.
I saved my money to buy a toy.
Mr Jones is our teacher.
Mrs Smith lives next door.
My parents are coming to watch.
We open presents at Christmas.
